intro: Lychnis multicaulis, commonly known as the clusteredachen, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lychnis multicaulis is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
